title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern, responsive dashboard built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository demonstrates best practices for building server-rendered React applications, focusing on efficient data fetching, UI component design, and a clean project structure suitable for various dashboard implementations.

title: next-voting
description: Next-Voting is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that provides a modern and user-friendly platform for creating and participating in polls and voting events. This repository encompasses all the necessary code and resources to run a complete voting application, focusing on accessibility, security, and ease of use for both administrators and voters. It's a versatile solution suitable for a wide range of applications, from simple opinion polls to complex election scenarios.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the LaTeX source code for my resume. It leverages the power of TeX to create a professional and visually appealing document. As a personal project, it demonstrates my skills in typesetting and document design using TeX.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a project leveraging TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, HTML, Express.js, and Vite.js to build an application interfacing with the Gemini API. This repository serves as a learning project showcasing the integration of modern web technologies with AI capabilities.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebook and Python, contains various finance-related projects. It explores financial concepts and techniques through practical coding examples, covering topics like data analysis, portfolio optimization, and risk management, all within a Python-based environment.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This project, built with HTML and Python, focuses on map visualization techniques. It explores methods for creating and displaying geographical data on interactive maps, providing a practical demonstration of data representation and analysis within a geospatial context. The repository serves as a learning resource and starting point for those interested in visualizing data on maps.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, providing a collaborative platform to capture, organize, and prioritize project ideas. This interactive board allows users to brainstorm, visualize workflows, and manage concepts from initial inception to fully-fledged plans, facilitating effective project management and fostering creative collaboration.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a Python-based CRUD application built with Flask, utilizing PostgreSQL for data storage. This project demonstrates fundamental web development principles and serves as a practical example of implementing create, read, update, and delete operations using Python, HTML, CSS, and shell scripting, covering topics relevant to full-stack development and database management.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a web-based interface for monitoring and interacting with a Robofleet robotics system. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, it allows users to visualize robot data, control robot actions, and manage the overall fleet. This project serves as a comprehensive dashboard solution for Robofleet deployments, offering real-time insights and control capabilities.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a Next.js project built with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Supabase, designed to provide a robust platform for tracking IoT assets. This repository implements a user-friendly interface and backend infrastructure for managing and monitoring IoT devices, leveraging modern web technologies to create a scalable and efficient asset tracking solution.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a project built using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to create a dynamic and interactive event calendar. This repository provides a foundation for displaying, managing, and customizing event schedules, offering a user-friendly interface for organizing and presenting events in a visually appealing and easily navigable manner.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, it provides a user-friendly interface to parse, filter, and display ROS log data, aiding in debugging and understanding robot system behavior. This project focuses on improving ROS log analysis workflows.
